content.rendered:
Search Developer.Salesforce.com Want to search the Salesforce Developer site using the power of Google?  Look no further! I created this custom search for just that.  This search box searches the https://developer.salesforce.com site using a custom google search.  Your results will be from Help & Training, but powered by Google’s awesomeness.
Just enter what you want to search for in the box below, click enter, and you’ll be on your way!  Don’t forget to try out the Google Search Hacks to help narrow down your results!

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce DevTools
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: This tool is fantastic for so many reasons, it's called Salesforce DevTools but really it's for more than just Devs. Use it with Debug Logs (great for working with Process Builder and Flow - not just code), ERD's, Data, queries, exports and more! Once you try it, you'll want to…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce Advanced Code Searcher
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Sometimes you know the Apex Class or Visualforce page you need to go to, but to get there, ugg, Click Setup, Click Develop, Click Apex Classes, Letter S, Next Page, Next Page, Next Page, AHHH. Freakin’ can drive a dev or admin nuts, seriously.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce ORGanizer
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: The ORGanizer, if you only have one extension, make it this one. The ORGanizer has so many awesome features and so much functionality, it's hard to decide where to start. The extension is called the best Salesforce Extension EVER for a reason.  You can do so much with it, and…
